node.title: Reunited Couple Says Near-Divorce Left Them $100K in Debt in Video Viewed 6M Times
node.description: "The silver lining is [that] paying it off taught y'all how to grow [and] have a healthy marriage," one commenter said of the couple's situation.

node.title: Southern Queenslanders on high alert as major flooding sends towns underwater amid days-long deluge
node.description: Heavy rain is easing today across southern Queensland but, with catchments already saturated, hundreds of residents in Inglewood, Yelarbon and Texas will remain on high alert after major flooding inundated homes.

node.title: What is known about Jeffrey Epstein’s suicide.
node.description: In the more than two years since Mr. Epstein’s death, investigative records have shed new light on his last days.

node.title: Gavin Newsom Says 'There's No Reason to Panic' as First Omicron Case Found in California
node.description: The governor encouraged Californians to seek out COVID-19 booster shots and wear masks indoors to protect themselves against the virus.

node.title: Suicide, forced puberty and underage marriage on the rise as young girls 'bear the brunt' of Syria's war
node.description: Ten years of conflict has taken a devastating toll on Syrian girls with child marriage, forced puberty, suicide and self harm on the rise, according to a new report.

node.title: Policy failures caused the historic decline in September quarter growth
node.description: The sharp fall in third-quarter GDP? It was the decline in economic activity we didn't have to have.

node.title: 'The world changes next week': Tasmania prepares to open border despite missed vaccination targets
node.description: Tasmania fell short of its 80 per cent vaccination target for those 16 and over last month. Another milestone was missed yesterday. It's charging towards reopening anyway. Here's what you need to know.

node.title: Under the cover of the COVID-19 pandemic, another killer has risen
node.description: The brutal murder of Hannah Clarke and her children sent shock waves across the nation, but it was short-lived, snatched away by what was perceived as a greater threat to come, writes Matt Wordsworth.

node.title: Fears over Peng Shuai sees WTA suspend all tournaments in China, Hong Kong
node.description: The Women's Tennis Association's decision to suspend tournaments in China and Hong Kong comes as uncertainty remains over the safety of Peng Shuai, who recently alleged on social media that she was assaulted by a senior Chinese political figure.

node.title: A Fashion Designer’s Favorite Challah, for Hanukkah or Whenever
node.description: Adapted from a recipe by Joan Nathan, Batsheva Hay’s preferred iteration of the classic Jewish bread is worth the time commitment.

node.title: Retail Theft Has Gotten Very Organized
node.description: Fortunately, there’s a solution.

node.title: Omicron is Here and New Covid-19 Drugs Are Coming. Will We Use Them Wisely?
node.description: The world must not repeat history by making Covid-19 drugs inaccessible.

node.title: This Year’s Winner of the Turner Prize? A Group That Performs Protest.
node.description: The Belfast-based Array Collective stages carnivalesque interventions at political rallies. Now the group has won Britain’s major art award.

node.title: New Species of Dog-Sized Dinosaur Found in Chile Had 'Really Bizarre Tail'
node.description: "Books on prehistoric animals for kids need to update and put this weird tail in there....It just looks crazy," Chilean paleontologist Alex Vargas said.

node.title: Florida Man Jailed Numerous Times Arrested in 1983 Killing of 21-Year-Old Woman
node.description: "I played this in my head a thousand times," the woman's sister said. "I never thought this day would come."

node.title: Fauci Stresses Masks, Vaccines, Boosters After First Case of Omicron Detected in U.S.
node.description: The nation's top infectious disease expert said officials knew it was "just a matter of time" before Omicron hit the U.S.

node.title: Kansas' Top Health Official Says He Was 'Fauci'd' Out of Job After Politicization of COVID
node.description: "It was [like] sticking a stick into the spokes of a bicycle," Dr. Lee Norman said of the political tensions that led to his departure.

node.title: Lady Jane in Spain: The Australian mango enjoying sweet success internationally
node.description: It was developed near Katherine in the NT, but there are now commercial plantings of this mango in Spain and trials underway in more than 10 countries.

node.title: Claire quit her job and sold her possessions — then Omicron changed everything
node.description: Claire Ebersohn was only two days away from starting her new life in Australia but global panic over the Omicron strain of COVID-19 has locked her out of the country.

node.title: Obeid-backed development at Hawks Nest to face legal challenge from traditional owners
node.description: Plans for a controversial apartment development in the beachside town of Hawks Nest, secretly backed by the family of corrupt NSW politician Eddie Obeid, are set to be challenged in court by traditional owners.

node.title: Large attendance variations in Auckland schools
node.description: Auckland schools are reporting wildly different attendance rates with some families refusing to send children back to class.

node.title: CIA publishes new account describing "challenges" of briefing Trump
node.description: "Trump was like Nixon, suspicious and insecure about the intelligence process, but unlike Nixon in the way he reacted," according to a new  account.

node.title: WTA Suspends Tournaments in China Over Missing Tennis Star Peng Shuai
node.description: Steve Simon said Wednesday that the women’s tennis tour would not stage tournaments in China, including Hong Kong, because he has been unable to communicate with Peng despite repeated attempts.

node.title: Women's Tennis Tournaments in China, Hong Kong Suspended Amid Peng Shuai Controversy
node.description: "China's leaders have left the WTA with no choice," WTA Chairman Scott Simon said on Wednesday regarding the decision to suspend tournaments.

node.title: Internet Roasts Woman After Her Hilarious Pumpkin Pie Fail Goes Viral
node.description: "Did you try to bake the pie and self-clean the oven at the same time?" asked one Facebook commenter.

node.title: Oxford School Shooter Identified as 15-Year-Old Ethan Crumbley, Faces Adult Charges
node.description: The teenage suspect in Tuesday's shooting was named by the prosecutor hours after a fourth student died.

node.title: Champagne more expensive but local sparkling makers say their bubbles are just as good
node.description: Australia is in the midst of a champagne shortage and there is no chance of summer discounts or bulk deals this year, according to local importers.

node.title: Older and wiser Warrior returns to NRL home
node.description: Sitting up there wearing the old colours and once again part of a club that never should have forced him out in the first place, he sure looked like the old Shaun Johnson.

node.title: 'I Didn't Steal It': TikToker Claims Issues With Security System in Viral Video
node.description: While at a self-checkout station, the TikToker said he scanned his item but the system did not recognize it and an employee had to respond.

node.title: ‘Annie Live!’: Coming Soon to Your Living Room
node.description: NBC’s latest TV musical airs Thursday night and features three women of color — Taraji P. Henson, Nicole Scherzinger and Celina Smith — in leading roles.
